title: [Please Help] After Champion Select- Client Crash- Bugsplat error
body:
Just recently my game has been crashing every time league is loading up after champion select. It will go to the count down, the league of legends emblem will deploy. The screen goes black for a split second and then I receive a bugsplat report:

_______________________________________________________________

**League of Legends caused ACCESS_VIOLATION in module League of Legends

Read from location 0000000c caused an access violation.

System Information:
    4 processor(s), type 586.
    34% of memory in use.
    7113M total physical memory.
    4643M free physical memory.
    8905M total paging file.
    6199M free paging file.
    4095M total virtual memory.
    3720M free virtual memory.

Process Memory:
    3720M free.
      86M reserved.
     288M commited.
    Largest free block is 2020M.

    PageFaultCount: 57556
    PeakWorkingSetSize: 106M
    WorkingSetSize: 106M
    QuotaPeakPagedPoolUsage: 0M
    QuotaPagedPoolUsage: 0M
    QuotaPeakNonPagedPoolUsage: 0M
    QuotaNonPagedPoolUsage: 0M
    PagefileUsage: 160M
    PeakPagefileUsage: 194M
**
 
___________________________________________________________

I am running on Windows 10, and I have a hunch that it was a windows update that caused this.... but I don't have much of a technical knowledge to actually know if this is possible. I have looked up online and made sure everything was up to date, reinstalled, deleted/renamed logictech files, etc. Nothing has worked and all I want to do is play league before I head off to college.... please... help.

~UpsetTurtle
{{champion:134}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:89}}

replies.body:
If the LoL client was working before the windows update, you are able to go back to the previous windows version. To do this, repeat these steps:
windows key- type check for updates- in that screen somewhere you should see update history as well as the option to backdate. Follow those steps and you will have to sit through a restart etc but it worked for me :D{{item:3512}}
Did exactly what you said and it's working know, thanks!! ^^

For Windows 10, the Anniversary update included some changes to the Xbox app that enabled Game DVR by default, which can cause some crashing and low FPS issues for some players. I recommend completely disabling this feature temporarily, to see if it resolves the issue. You can find a walkthrough on how to do this [here](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html).

Let me know if this helped.
I tried it, but didn't work so I just restored my computer to the previous update. Thanks for the suggestion however :)
this has been happening to my brother and I and we have been able to play if we switch to the free xfinitywifi coming from our modem but we can't play on our home wifi
